tagline.en: I use engineering to ask philosophical questions: what can we know from data? How do we make assumptions testable? What makes a model trustworthy? My work spans causal inference, interpretable ML, and biosignal processing—not as separate domains, but as different expressions of the same inquiry: building systems that respect epistemic limits and explain their reasoning.
tagline.it: Uso l'ingegneria per porre domande filosofiche: cosa possiamo sapere dai dati? Come rendiamo testabili le assunzioni? Cosa rende affidabile un modello? Il mio lavoro spazia tra inferenza causale, ML interpretabile e biosegnali—non come domini separati, ma come espressioni diverse della stessa indagine: costruire sistemi che rispettano i limiti epistemici e spiegano il loro ragionamento.

bullets.en: I interrogate causality: what moves what? How do we test causal claims against data?
bullets.it: Interrogo la causalità: cosa muove cosa? Come testiamo le ipotesi causali sui dati?

bullets.en: I demand explainability: models that can articulate their reasoning and expose their limits
bullets.it: Richiedo spiegabilità: modelli che articolano il loro ragionamento ed espongono i loro limiti

bullets.en: I enforce reproducibility: explicit assumptions, testable pipelines, verifiable conclusions
bullets.it: Impongo riproducibilità: assunzioni esplicite, pipeline testabili, conclusioni verificabili

bullets.en: I traverse domains (biosignals, BI, finance) to extract transferable patterns, not accumulate specializations
bullets.it: Attraverso domini (biosegnali, BI, finanza) per estrarre pattern trasferibili, non accumulare specializzazioni

paragraph.en: I'm drawn to the activity of thinking itself—the process of connecting ideas, questioning assumptions, and building understanding. I approach problems through structured reasoning: making constraints explicit, testing models against reality, and preferring clarity over complexity. My work in causal inference and interpretable ML is an expression of this: systems that explain their logic, make their assumptions testable, and respect the limits of what we can know. Beyond work, I'm fascinated by philosophical inquiry, investing/personal finance (as applied decision theory), and hands-on building—whether that's repairing things, running a Chia miner, or designing new tools. First and foremost, I'm a human being who values collaboration, intellectual honesty, and the joy of understanding how things actually work.
paragraph.it: Sono attratto dall'attività del pensare in sé—il processo di connettere idee, mettere in discussione assunzioni e costruire comprensione. Affronto i problemi attraverso il ragionamento strutturato: rendere i vincoli espliciti, testare i modelli contro la realtà e preferire la chiarezza alla complessità. Il mio lavoro nell'inferenza causale e nel ML interpretabile è un'espressione di questo: sistemi che spiegano la loro logica, rendono testabili le loro assunzioni e rispettano i limiti di ciò che possiamo sapere. Al di là del lavoro, sono affascinato dall'indagine filosofica, dagli investimenti/finanza personale (come teoria decisionale applicata) e dalla costruzione pratica—che sia riparare oggetti, gestire un miner di Chia o progettare nuovi strumenti. Prima di tutto, sono un essere umano che valorizza la collaborazione, l'onestà intellettuale e la gioia di capire come funzionano davvero le cose.

en: What can we reliably know from data, and where do claims exceed evidence?
How do we make assumptions explicit enough to be challenged?
What makes a model trustworthy beyond statistical fit?
Why does the same pattern appear in biosignals, business processes, and investment decisions?
it: Cosa possiamo sapere in modo affidabile dai dati, e dove le affermazioni eccedono l'evidenza?
Come rendiamo le assunzioni esplicite abbastanza da poter essere contestate?
Cosa rende un modello affidabile al di là del fit statistico?
Perché lo stesso pattern emerge in biosegnali, processi aziendali e decisioni di investimento?

en: I privilege structure over accumulation: transferable models > domain-specific tricks
I insist on epistemic hygiene: every model must articulate what it cannot know
I treat domains as lenses, not silos: biosignals and business analytics share the same causal logic
I value philosophical rigor in technical work: engineering is applied epistemology
it: Privilegio struttura su accumulo: modelli trasferibili > trucchi domain-specific
Insisto sull'igiene epistemica: ogni modello deve articolare ciò che non può sapere
Tratto i domini come lenti, non silos: biosegnali e analytics aziendale condividono la stessa logica causale
Valorizzo rigore filosofico nel lavoro tecnico: l'ingegneria è epistemologia applicata

why_diverse_domains.en: I work across biosignals, business intelligence, and finance not out of indecision, but to extract invariant patterns. Causal graphs, explainability constraints, reproducibility requirements—these transcend application context. My output is not domain expertise; it's transferable reasoning frameworks.
why_diverse_domains.it: Lavoro tra biosegnali, business intelligence e finanza non per indecisione, ma per estrarre pattern invarianti. Grafi causali, vincoli di spiegabilità, requisiti di riproducibilità—questi trascendono il contesto applicativo. Il mio output non è expertise di dominio; sono framework di ragionamento trasferibili.

commitment.en: I'm not here to accumulate skills or chase trends. I'm here to influence how people reason about uncertainty, evidence, and decisions—using technology as the medium, not the message.
commitment.it: Non sono qui per accumulare competenze o inseguire trend. Sono qui per influenzare come le persone ragionano su incertezza, evidenza e decisioni—usando la tecnologia come medium, non come messaggio.

source.title: PhD Annual Report
source.note: Extracted factual bullets only; no full text.

research_objective: Conceive and design a home neuromotor telerehabilitation system for stroke patients using low-cost technologies.
Enable therapy personalization (including remote) and continuous tracking of patient progress in the home environment.
Provide biofeedback/feedback (including AI-assisted guidance) to support correct execution and adherence.
architecture_stack: TV-based user interface running on Android smart TV / Android TV box (Minix NEO U9-H).
Unity3D used for the gamified virtual environment and UI.
Biomechanical sensing via magneto-inertial measurement units (MUSE by 221e).
Custom pressure sensors integrated as insole, glove, and under-elbow sensors.
Multi-sensor connectivity using Bluetooth Classic (multiple devices) to the TV box.
Store-and-forward telemonitoring: patient results uploaded and stored server-side for clinician review.
Web application built with Django (Python) + PostgreSQL, served via Nginx + Gunicorn.
innovation: Per-repetition metrics computed and stored (e.g., joint angles, execution time, errors, score).
Gamified feedback loop: daily results and performance history shown to motivate continuation.
Two interface modalities planned/implemented for comparison: exergames vs 'serious' interface.
Clinician-configurable safety limits (e.g., ROM/force) and remote configuration updates via downloadable config file.
validation_plan: System development focused on modular exercise blocks; 2 of 5 blocks integrated at the time of the report.
Initial tuning and testing performed on healthy subjects to calibrate parameters and validate smooth operation.
Planned preliminary inpatient testing at the San Michele Hospital stroke unit (Cagliari) for patient-experience tuning.
Pilot randomized controlled trial planned with 8-week protocol, 5 days/week, and 3-month follow-up.
Experimental arm planned with two groups (10 exergames, 10 serious interface); comparator group planned: home rehab without the system (20 matched subjects).
Inclusion criteria captured: age 40–75; first stroke affecting left side; within 6 months from acute event.
Usability/acceptability planned via semi-structured interviews and validated questionnaires: IPPA, PIADS, QUEST, SUS.
Trial start planned for January 2020; results intended for analysis/publication after completion.
engineering_challenges: Managing and synchronizing multiple Bluetooth Classic connections (multi-device) was a major implementation issue.
Unity ↔ Android constraints prevented using native Android APIs/threads directly; solution used C# coroutine-based architecture.
Unity scenes mapped to Android activities, causing scene-switch/lifecycle freezes; mitigated by closing connections and reinitializing MUSE scripts on transitions.
dissemination: Poster presented at Unica&Imprese (CREA, UniCA) on home neuromotor telerehabilitation for stroke with advanced electronic devices.
Project showcased during La notte dei ricercatori (September 27, 2019).
Contribution accepted at SIAMOC 2019 (University of Bologna, October 9–12, 2019): poster and oral presentation on a home-based stroke telerehab system using magneto-inertial units.
DoMoMEA planned to be showcased at a midterm project event (October 2019) with blocks 1–2.
training_teaching: Course: Robotics technologies for sensorimotor rehabilitation (IIT, Jan 14–17, 2019) — 5 credits — passed.
Course: Advanced EEG analysis (web course, Apr 1–12, 2019) — 5 credits — waiting response.
English language course (C1 level) at Centro Linguistico di Ateneo (Mar 18–Jul 8, 2019).
Summer School on Neurorehabilitation 2019 (Vigo, Spain, Sept 15–20, 2019) — participation.
Teaching assistantship: C.I. di Progettazione Elettronica — 70 hours (Prof. Luigi Raffo; Prof. Piero Cosseddu).

one_liner.en: Moving beyond correlation: making causal assumptions explicit, testable, and challengeable. The goal is not 'finding causality' but articulating what we're assuming and where the reasoning can break.
one_liner.it: Oltre la correlazione: rendere le assunzioni causali esplicite, testabili e contestabili. L'obiettivo non è 'trovare causalità' ma articolare cosa assumiamo e dove il ragionamento può rompersi.

one_liner.en: Interpretability is not optional decoration; it's epistemic necessity. Models must articulate their logic, expose their drivers, and declare their limits. Otherwise, they're black boxes pretending to be knowledge.
one_liner.it: L'interpretabilità non è decorazione opzionale; è necessità epistemica. I modelli devono articolare la loro logica, esporre i loro driver e dichiarare i loro limiti. Altrimenti sono scatole nere che fingono di essere conoscenza.

one_liner.en: If someone else can't rebuild your analysis from your code and data, you haven't done science—you've told a story. Explicit I/O, config-driven pipelines, and automated testing are philosophical commitments, not just engineering habits.
one_liner.it: Se qualcun altro non può ricostruire la tua analisi dal tuo codice e dati, non hai fatto scienza—hai raccontato una storia. I/O esplicito, pipeline config-driven e testing automatizzato sono impegni filosofici, non solo abitudini ingegneristiche.

one_liner.en: The same structural questions recur in biosignal analysis, business forecasting, and investment decisions. I'm not 'doing different things'—I'm applying the same epistemic framework to different substrate. The goal is transferable reasoning, not accumulated specialization.
one_liner.it: Le stesse domande strutturali ricorrono nell'analisi dei biosegnali, nel forecasting aziendale e nelle decisioni di investimento. Non sto 'facendo cose diverse'—applico lo stesso framework epistemico a substrati diversi. L'obiettivo è ragionamento trasferibile, non specializzazione accumulata.

one_liner.en: From problem definition to proof-of-concept with reproducible experiments.
one_liner.it: Dal problema al proof-of-concept con esperimenti riproducibili.

operatingSystem.title: Operating System
operatingSystem.lead: Decision rules that keep the ecosystem coherent as it scales.

blocks.title: Boundary & governance
items: Governance is functional: each container answers one question.
BMI: does this knowledge need to exist even if the market disappears?
For-profit: does this knowledge create economic value if applied now?
If the boundary decision is ambiguous → it stays in BMI.

blocks.title: IP & data placement
items: IP originates in BMI; exploitation is optional, deferred, and selective.
Data belongs to the truth layer that makes it interpretable.
If a dataset improves the model → BMI; if it improves service delivery → for-profit.

blocks.title: Scaling & stop rules
items: Scale modules, reuse, licenses, and interpretations — not user cognitive complexity.
Stop if it’s not modellable, explainable, and verifiable.
Stop if it forces boundary ambiguity or epistemic compromises.
